BRUTALLY.Definition: in a very cruel or violent way

HINDSIGHT.Definition: understanding of the situation after it happened

SYSTEMIC.Definition: part of the system or government

RUNAWAY INFLATION.Definition: very fast and out-of-control rising prices

SWORN IN.Definition: officially given the job or role

DETAIN.Definition: keep people in a place and not let them leave

WITH AN IRON FIST.Definition: in a very strict or harsh way

STEADY HAND.Definition: someone with calm and careful control

VOLATILE.Definition: likely to change quickly, often in a bad way

PROPPED HIM UP.Definition: supported him so he could stay in power

CRONIES.Definition: close friends who helped each other in a dishonest way

EGREGIOUSLY.Definition: in a very bad or shocking way

SUFFOCATING.Definition: feeling trapped or unable to breathe emotionally

SCRAPING BY.Definition: just managing to live with very little

BATON.Definition: a short stick used by police

TIPPING POINT.Definition: the moment when it started to happen

DOMINO.Definition: one event that caused others to happen one after another

BRIBES.Definition: money given to leave him alone

WEIGHING SCALES.Definition: a machine or device for weighing products

MATCH.Definition: a short, thin piece of wood used to light a fire

DEFIANCE.Definition: refusing to follow rules or obey

BOIL OVER.Definition: suddenly explode in anger or action

MAKE ENDS MEET.Definition: have just enough money to live

FOCAL POINT.Definition: the main place or centre of attention

GRASSROOTS.Definition: starting with regular people, not leaders

HARASSMENT.Definition: being treated in a mean or unwanted way again and again

EXTORTED.Definition: robbed with the use of force or threats

CHANTED.Definition: shouted the same words again and again

TEAR GAS.Definition: a gas that made people cry and leave the area

RUBBER BULLETS.Definition: bullets made of rubber, used to hurt but not kill

DISPERSE.Definition: break up and go in different directions

STOOD THEIR GROUND.Definition: refused to move or give up

EPICENTRE.Definition: the central or most important place

CAMPING OUT.Definition: staying outside in tents or sleeping bags

RESHUFFLING.Definition: changing people’s jobs or roles in the government

CABINET.Definition: the group of top government leaders

UNTENABLE.Definition: not able to continue or work anymore

ERUPTED.Definition: expressed their feelings in a sudden and noisy way or broke out

TOKEN.Definition: just for show, not real or full

RADICAL.Definition: very new and different from usual

POWER GRAB.Definition: an attempt to take control unfairly

SAFE PAIR OF HANDS.Definition: someone they could trust to be careful and calm

ON ITS KNEES.Definition: in great trouble or very weak

VULTURES.Definition: people waiting to take advantage of others' problems

OVERREACHED.Definition: tried to do too much and failed

BOILING POINT.Definition: the moment when anger or trouble exploded

ULTIMATUM.Definition: a final demand before action was taken

ITCHING.Definition: wants to do it very much

COUP.Definition: sudden takeover of power by force

SIT-INS.Definition: protests where people stayed in a place and refused to leave

STORMED.Definition: rushed in quickly and with force

ROUNDED UP.Definition: gathered and taken away by force

STRONGMAN.Definition: a leader who ruled with force

WITH A VENGEANCE.Definition: with even more force than before

WRESTLING WITH.Definition: trying hard to solve or work out
